text: a sea of mud and debris after the dam
burst thick radish dirt gushed into the
rural district of bento Rodrigues
outside the old colonial town of Mariana
in miniaturize it removed rooftops
dragged trucks and destroyed homes this
car was left perched on top of a
building testament to the force of the
blow the deluge settled into a dense
surface of mud engulfing part of the
district this was home to around 500
people the dam was used to store mineral
residue from the production of iron ore
in the region a huge pool of water earth
and chemicals firefighters and
helicopters have rescued several people
that were stranded but searches on the
ground have not yet started access is
restricted due to fears of new
landslides the dam belongs to Samarco a
mining enterprise it says the cause of
the rupture is not yet clear and they
are making every effort to help the
victims and mitigate environmental
impact julika Janero
BBC News Rio de Janeiro
